meanings.definition: To remove the seam or seams from (something)
meanings.sent1: She unseamed the dress to make it fit better.
meanings.sent2: The tailor unseamed the old curtains to repurpose the fabric.
meanings.sent3: He unseamed the paper with such precision, it looked like magic.
meanings.sent4: The unseamed sky revealed a tapestry of stars above.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon unseamed the patient's wound with steady hands.

meanings.definition: To become separated at the seam
meanings.sent1: The old book unseamed along the spine from years of use.
meanings.sent2: The worn-out backpack unseamed during the hike.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffed suitcase unseamed itself right before the trip.
meanings.sent4: The boat unseamed as it hit the rough waves.
meanings.sent5: The balloon unseamed and flew away into the sky.
